title: The Last Day of a Condemned
creator: Victor Hugo
description: LibriVox recording of The Last Day of a Condemned, by Victor Hugo. Translated by Sir P. Hesketh-Fleetwood. Read by Alisson Veldhuis; part of Section 2 read by Nadine Eckert-Boulet. A man who has been condemned to death writes down his cogitations, feelings and fears while he is waiting for his execution. He does not betray his name to the reader or what he has done. He describes his life in prison, everything from what his cell looks like to the personality of the prison priest. (Introduction by Wikipedia) For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording. For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org. M4B format available
subject: librivox; literature; audiobook; fiction
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
